info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 11:43AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Central Rowan County and a small portion of northwest Cabarrus County. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring in low-lying and poor drainage areas along North Second Creek and Grants Creek. River or stream flows will remain elevated into early Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM EST, automated gauge reports indicated a few streams in the area have risen out of their banks. In particular, North Second Creek near US 70 is flooding low- lying areas adjacent to N Second Creek, with minor impacts to vulnerable properties near the creek. Nearby farmland and other low-lying areas are inundated with 2 to 4 ft of water. Water could cover some crossings upstream, possibly including White Rd, Lyerly Rd, Upright Rd, Graham Rd, Hall Rd, Childers Rd, and Bear Poplar Rd. Also, Grants Creek at Rowan Mill Rd near Salisbury has risen out of its banks and could cause similar impacts on roads in that area. Small streams elsewhere in western and central Rowan County could continue to rise for a time today before receding, and some additional low-water crossings could be impacted. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. Second Creek is not expected to rise to a level that will cause property impacts but it is important to stay vigilant for slight rises beyond what has already occurred. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kannapolis, Salisbury, China Grove, Spencer, Landis, Enochville, Cleveland, Piedmont Research Station, Woodleaf and Mount Ulla. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
